item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, May 31, 2025 at 5:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Photos taken inside musical instruments (445 points | 23 comments)
2. Valkey Turns One: Community fork of Redis (105 points | 27 comments)
3. Surprisingly fast AI-generated kernels we didn't mean to publish yet (234 points | 59 comments)
4. Mary Meeker's first Trends report since 2019, focused on AI (116 points | 39 comments)
5. Reverse engineering of Linear's sync engine (58 points | 3 comments)
6. Beating Google's kernelCTF PoW using AVX512 (268 points | 81 comments)
7. The 'white-collar bloodbath' is all part of the AI hype machine (332 points | 552 comments)
8. Show HN: MCP Defender – OSS AI Firewall for Protecting MCP in Cursor/Claude etc. (11 points | 6 comments)
9. Show HN: Icepi Zero – The FPGA Raspberry Pi Zero Equivalent (117 points | 25 comments)
10. How large should your sample size be? (10 points | 1 comment)
11. Microsandbox: Virtual Machines that feel and perform like containers (279 points | 127 comments)
12. Revenge of the Chickenized Reverse-Centaurs (73 points | 21 comments)
13. Java Virtual Threads Ate My Memory: A Web Crawler's Tale of Speed vs. Memory (45 points | 15 comments)
14. Systems Correctness Practices at Amazon Web Services (315 points | 111 comments)
15. Every 5x5 Nonogram (36 points | 11 comments)
16. Silicon Valley finally has a big electronics retailer again: Micro Center opens (187 points | 101 comments)
17. Ray Tracing in J (55 points | 8 comments)
18. Anthropic launches a voice mode for Claude (66 points | 19 comments)
19. The Darwin Gödel Machine: AI that improves itself by rewriting its own code (154 points | 157 comments)
20. Jerry Lewis's “The Day the Clown Cried” discovered in Sweden after 53 years (147 points | 68 comments)
21. StackAI (YC W23) Is Looking for SWR and Tailwind Wizards ( | hide)
22. How to run cron jobs in Postgres without extra infrastructure (56 points | 20 comments)
23. Show HN: Leap – Full-stack AI developer agent that deploys to AWS (11 points | discuss)
24. Show HN: Smart Silence – Remind your iPhone to stay quiet in quiet places (27 points | 9 comments)
25. Adam Riess and the Hubble tension (78 points | 66 comments)
26. Copy Excel to Markdown Table (and vice versa) (76 points | 14 comments)
27. De Bruijn notation, and why it's useful (124 points | 34 comments)
28. Show HN: Circle Crop Image (6 points | 5 comments)
29. A Smiling Public Man (39 points | 2 comments)
30. Why Writing by Hand Is Better for Memory and Learning (29 points | 12 comments)
